sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: You're watching Euronews Now, I'm Rahim Zaidi and these are the headlines this hour.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Moscow announces the end of the first phase of the so-called special operation in Ukraine, saying it will now focus on establishing control of the eastern Donbass region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The deadliest attack on civilians so far, Ukraine says the death toll from a Russian airstrike on the theatre in Mariupol now stands at 300.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The EU summit wraps in Brussels as leaders reaffirm phasing out dependency on Russian energy as soon as possible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And here in the Cube, we take a closer look at a new EU law that could rein in the powers of big tech companies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: law that could rein in the powers of big tech companies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Good evening. In what could signal a change in military strategy, Moscow has announced the end of the first phase of the so-called special operation in Ukraine. Senior Russian defence official Sergo Rutskoi said that Ukraine's fighting capacity has been reduced and Russian forces could now focus on taking control of the eastern Donbas region. The announcement comes as the Pentagon says Russia has lost full control of Kherson, the first major Ukrainian city it captured. Well let's now take a closer look at how the ground offensive is

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: advancing in Ukraine. Sasha Vakulina breaks down the latest military movements across the country one month since the Russian invasion of Ukraine and the Institute for the study of war released an animated map describing how it happened now it starts on the 23rd of February the day before and then it goes step by step date by date on the Russian invasion of Ukraine look at this here in the red you could see these are the Russian troops as they invaded and tried to get as much territory as possible the 10th of March the 11th of March the 12th you could see how the tried coming from the east of the country and the north of Ukraine how they tried to get to towards the central part of Ukraine and towards clear the capital now according to the latest information and the latest map this is how the situation looks now the Russian forces are there indicating the red with the direction of their moves of their intentions and here in the blue if you could see here in the south and the southeast of the country also in the east towards Kharkiv and Luhansk those blue areas are the areas of massive protests of Ukrainian people on those territories now occupied by Russian troops against this occupation the situation also looks different in the region of Kyiv the capital look at this this is the map that goes with the radius of 25 kilometers around keep and here in the blue you could see these are the areas that Ukrainian troops started to taking back this is where they started their counter-attacks regaining some of the territories of course also here this is the West and the northwest of Kiev this is where some of the heaviest fighting's has been happening during this month of war now the fact that Ukrainian troops have been regaining some towns back and getting their defensive positions back is now also confirmed confirmed by the UK's defense ministry and their latest intelligence update local officials in the Ukrainian

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: city of Mariupol say that as many as 300 people were killed in the March 16 bombing of a theater where hundreds of civilians were seeking shelter Russia has denied responsibility for the airstrike which hit the building despite the word children being written in large white letters outside the were seeking shelter. Russia has denied responsibility for the airstrike which hit the building despite the word children being written in large white letters outside the theatre. If the death toll is confirmed, it would be the deadliest known attack on civilians since the start of the war one month ago. Ukraine is still struggling to evacuate thousands of people who remain trapped in the besieged port city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Euronews international correspondent Annalise Borges is in the western city of Lviv, where she's been talking to Ukrainians who have managed to escape Mariupol.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: They shared some harrowing stories of the destruction and heartbreak they left behind.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Take a look.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: I was born in Mariupol and lived in Mariupol my entire life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It was so beautiful lately.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It was a city one could live in.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: We had the sea. All was good.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I love the sea so much.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: I will not see the sea ever again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This is Mariupol now, after four weeks of almost nonstop Russian shelling. Natalia witnessed most of it from the basement of her home. It was right above our heads.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Planes would fly from 3 a.m.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And every 10 minutes you would hear a plane passing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And I guess some of our defense system was nearby.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And they would fire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And every time they hit a target, everything shook.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We were just sitting there thinking the next one is for, thinking the next one is for us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The next one is for us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Natalia survived 20 days without electricity, running water and very little food.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Many of her neighbors weren't so lucky.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The house next to us was hit by a bomb.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The house got destroyed, and our neighbors stayed under the rubble.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And two other neighbors went to get him out and were killed by the shelling.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: With most humanitarian corridors failing to evacuate civilians, her son-in-law-law Victor took the desperate decision to go in and take Natalia out He wasn't prepared for what he saw it looked it looked like like hell the 90% of the buildings were hit Half of them were like burned and then there were a lot of dogs in the street like you could see they they are they're roaming around in search for food and uh the the there were piles of of trash i saw like two bodies one was covered and the other was the guy who just they just laid in the street and and and explosions all the time and planes flying in the skies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I felt like I was in a game or something, like it was like a computer game or something, and then I couldn't, I cannot still believe that it happened.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Victor doesn't want to be identified because he is scared of not having access to Russian-controlled areas in the coming weeks, as he hopes to continue helping people on the other side.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: As for Mariupol, he says he doesn't think the city will be rebuilt.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: I'm really at a loss what to say.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I don't see any future there anyways.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: I don't know, not at least for the following 10 years, 20 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Thank you very much, Vladimir Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Annelies Borges in Lviv for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A two-day EU leaders' summit in Brussels has come to an end.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The talks centred largely on strategies aimed at dealing with Europe's dependency on Russian energy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: President Biden had praised Western allies for unity in the face of President Putin's military aggression.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But after lengthy discussions in the European Council, tensions appeared to surface.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Our correspondent Shona Murray was following the action in Brussels and she has this report.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The EU's two-day summit has been much longer and tense than expected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Heads of state and government are trying to find ways to contain the skyrocketing rise in energy prices.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: There was clear division between those that were for and against intervening in the energy market for fear of disrupting supply chains and the role of renewables.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Finally, an arrangement was made for Spain and Portugal, who were asking for a temporary cap on electricity prices.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Indeed, the Iberian Peninsula has a very special situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: There, the energy mix is with a high load of renewables, this is very good, and with very few interconnections only.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And therefore, we agreed on a special treatment that is possible for the Iberian Peninsula so that the Iberian Peninsula can deal with this very specific situation they are in. Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez was one of the most belligerent countries. At one point he even left the meeting room in protest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Among the most reluctant countries to intervene and accept his proposals was the Netherlands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But during the summit other decisions were taken. EU leaders wanted the European Commission to negotiate the common purchase of gas in the name of the 27 member states in order to get better prices.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: There was also an agreement on the need for increasing the levels of gas storage in Europe ahead of next winter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: 75% of the global pipeline gas market is the European market, so we have an enormous purchasing power. Therefore, I welcome that we will now use our collective bargaining power.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Instead of outbidding each other and driving prices up, we will pool our demand.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The war in Ukraine is one of the reasons for the rise in energy prices.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And everybody understands that Europe must be more autonomous and less dependent on Russian gas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Also, because it's one of the main sources of income for Moscow to finance the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Shona Murray, Euronews, Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Earlier in the day, US President Joe Biden and EU chief Ursula von der Leyen announced

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: a major deal on natural gas aimed at reducing Europe's reliance on Russian energy. Washington and its partners are set to increase gas exports to Europe, starting with an additional 15 billion cubic metres this year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Europe currently depends on Moscow for 40% of its total gas supply, a situation von der Leyen says is no longer tenable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: As you know, we aim to reduce this dependency on Russian fossil fuels and to get rid of it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And this can only be achieved through, of course, first of all, investment in renewables, but also through additional gas supplies, including LNG deliveries. So we want as Europeans to diversify away from Russia towards suppliers that we trust, that are our friends and that are reliable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Now after leaving Brussels, President Joe Biden travelled to Poland for a two-day visit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: On arrival, he visited US soldiers from the 82nd Airborne Division, based near the Ukrainian border. Before leaving for Warsaw and talks with his Polish counterpart Andrzej Duda, Biden reminded the troops of why they're there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The single most important thing that we can do from the outset is keep the democracies united in our opposition and our effort to curtail the devastation that is occurring at the hands of a man who, quite frankly, I think is a war criminal. And I think it will meet the legal definition of that as well.
